result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon T Schubert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA Surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school and obtain HDED.

Court finds that if the Defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the Defendant's interest to have this expunged and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with Leeann S.
Defendant to write letter of apology to his mother.
Attend Anger Management.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED - (nonworking hours) to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber/straight time also
To be performed within 1 year as a Condition of Probation.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC 12/29/15
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brandon T Schubert in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 75 days jail straight time STAYED for 1 year
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DVSurcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling and obtain HSED.  No violent contact with Leeann S..  Defendant to write letter of apology to his Mother. Anger Management. 
 DNA, surcharge is waived.
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service within one (1) year as a Condition of Probation.
- 20 days jail  Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 

Defense requests expunction. 
Court finds that if the defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the defendant's interest and society 
will not be harmed and grant expunction.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-25-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Brandon T Schubert in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense addresses the 180 diversion program. Defense needs to speak to the ADA for an offer. Court will give another date in 2 - 3 weeks for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
